title: Did These Words Originate with Ruth Bader Ginsburg?
subtitle: "I ask no favor for my sex. All I ask of our brethren is that they take their feet off our necks," a meme read.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Ruth Bader Ginsburg was the first to say, "I ask no favor for my sex. All I ask of our brethren is that they take their feet off our necks."

title: Is This John D. Rockefeller's 'Masonic Creed'?
subtitle: An anonymous email from 2002 continues to circulate online.
author: Dan Evon
statement: American tycoon and philanthropist John D. Rockefeller wrote a "masonic creed" that started with the sentence: "We will keep their lives short and their minds weak while pretending to do the opposite."

title: Is This a Real Quote by Nelson Mandela?
subtitle: A quote attributed to Mandela, former president of South Africa, said: "Fools divide themselves by race, color, gender, or religion."
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Nelson Mandela said, "Our world is not divided by race, color, gender, or religion. Our world is divided into wise people and fools. And fools divide themselves by race, color, gender, or religion."

title: Did Kamala Harris Say Joe Biden Is 'Trash to Me'?
subtitle: A quote lifted from a blog post about Harris and Biden was misattributed to Harris.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Vice presidential candidate Kamala Harris said Joe Biden is "trash to me."

title: Did Kurt Russell Share A Poem Opposing the Defunding of Police?
subtitle: A poem titled "The Badge" circulated on social media in June 2020 following nationwide protests calling for the defunding of police.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Actor Kurt Russell made public statements opposing the defunding of police and was linked to a poem dedicated to the work of law enforcement.

title: Did Fauci Compare Research About COVID-19 to That of Chickenpox?
subtitle: The comparison happened on Facebook and went viral in summer 2020.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Dr. Anthony Fauci compared emerging research about coronavirus with what the scientific community knows about chickenpox - as well as other viruses - and criticized people who were not taking steps to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

title: Did Dave Ramsey Warn About a 'Cashless Society'?
subtitle: A common tactic of purveyors of misinformation is to attach a well-known person to an opinion piece in an attempt to give those opinions credence.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Radio host Dave Ramsey wrote a viral message warning about a "cashless society."

title: Did Goebbels Say Intellectuals 'Would Always Yield to the Stronger'?
subtitle: "Arguments must be crude, clear, and forcible, and appeal to emotions and instincts, not the intellect," the Nazi propagandist supposedly proclaimed.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Nazi propagandist Joseph Goebbels said that "intellectuals would never be converted and would anyway always yield to the stronger."

title: Did the 1981 'Farmer's Almanac' Predict COVID-19?
subtitle: An old "prediction" got a new origin story.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: The 1981 Farmer's Almanac contained a passage predicting that a severe, pneumatic illness would spread around the globe in 2020.

title: Did Bill Gates Tell George Magazine That an 'Over-Populated Planet' Would Fall to a 'Lung-Attacking Virus'?
subtitle: Bill Gates was featured in a 1997 issue of George magazine, but so were other people.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill Gates is quoted in the February 1997 issue of George magazine as saying an "over-populated planet" would be "choked to extinction by a lung-attacking virus."

title: Did Former U.S. Rep. Trey Gowdy Suggest COVID-19 Was a Conspiracy Against Trump?
subtitle: Gowdy: "We have enough going on in our country right now without propagating misinformation."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former U.S. Rep. Trey Gowdy penned a text suggesting that COVID-19 was part of a conspiracy against U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Did Bill O'Reilly Write an Essay Calling COVID-19 a Chinese Bioweapon?
subtitle: A conspiracy-tinged essay attributed to the former Fox News host went viral on social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former Fox News host Bill O'Reilly wrote a viral essay claiming the COVID-19 pandemic was caused by a Chinese bioweapon.

title: Was This Pandemic Poem Written by Kathleen O'Mara in 1919?
subtitle: A global pandemic did indeed inspire this poem. But that's as far as it goes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kathleen O'Mara is the author of a poem written "during the 1919 pandemic."

title: Did Musician Tommy Lee Write This Open Letter to Donald Trump?
subtitle: The Mötley Crüe musician shared a letter on his Facebook page ... but we have questions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Tommy Lee wrote a letter to U.S. President Donald Trump that started "Dear F*cking Lunatic."

title: Is This a C. S. Lewis Quote from 1942?
subtitle: A "quote" shared widely during the COVID-19 pandemic may have felt timely, but that is probably because it was written in 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Author C. S. Lewis wrote a passage in "The Screwtape Letters" involving Satan wanting to "shut down businesses" and Jesus wanting to restore the family unit.

title: Did Johns Hopkins Publish This 'Excellent Summary' of COVID-19 Advice?
subtitle: If you're looking for reliable COVID-19 information from Johns Hopkins University, please check the university's website.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Johns Hopkins University published this "excellent summary" on avoiding COVID-19.

title: Did Trump Suggest Stopping Public Officials' Pay During Pandemic?
subtitle: It appears something got lost in translation here.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump advocated that the pay of public officials be stopped during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Ron Howard Pen the 'I Am a Liberal' Essay?
subtitle: Some people apparently think that tacking a celebrity's name onto a viral opinion can lend it some credibility.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Director Ron Howard penned an essay starting "I am a liberal, but that doesn't mean what a lot of you apparently think it does."

title: Did George Washington Say This About Citizens' Right to Bear Arms?
subtitle: George Washington is in the running for the United States' most misquoted president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President George Washington said, "When government takes away citizens' right to bear arms, it becomes citizens' duty to take away government's right to govern."

title: Did Robin Williams Say the 'Worst Thing in Life is Ending Up With People Who Make You Feel All Alone'?
subtitle: The famous actor may have said these words, but he didn't write them.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The quote "I used to think the worst thing in life was to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is ending up with people who make you feel all alone” originated with Robin Williams.

title: Did Lewis Carroll Say 'Everyone Wants a Magical Solution for Their Problem'?
subtitle: There are many lands: some of them have magic, some do not, and some need it.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Author Lewis Carroll wrote that "Everyone wants a magical solution for their problem, and everyone refuses to believe in magic."

title: Did Trump Ask If Americans Would 'Want a President Who Was Dumb Enough to Get Drafted?'
subtitle: What should be deferred is the further spreading of this quote meme.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump once said, "Sure, I got deferments. Would you really want a president who was dumb enough to let himself get drafted?"

title: Did Clint Eastwood Say, 'I Love When People Call Trump Stupid'?
subtitle: Attaching a celebrity's name to a piece of text is one way to help it go viral.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor/director Clint Eastwood wrote an opinion piece that started with the statement, "I love when people call Trump stupid."

title: Did Alexis de Tocqueville Say 'America Is Great Because She Is Good'?
subtitle: The statement has been frequently cited (in whole or in part) across the years by politicians, newspapers, books, and websites.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Alexis de Tocqueville wrote that "America is great because she is good."

title: Did Mookie Wilson Say Belief in Dinosaurs Helped Him Out of Batting Slumps?
subtitle: One of the factors behind the Mets' 1986 World Series win may have been a lack of 'dinosaur politics' in the club.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Mookie Wilson said believing in dinosaurs helped him break out of batting slumps.

title: Did John Lennon Say 'Ringo Wasn't Even the Best Drummer in the Beatles'?
subtitle: This was one of the more famous quotes about a Beatle.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: John Lennon once asserted that Ringo Starr "wasn't even the best drummer in the Beatles."

title: Did Advice Columnist Ann Landers Say This About Aging?
subtitle: It might be faster if we credited everyone at every age with authoring this quote.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: This quote can be attributed to advice columnist Ann Landers: “At age 20, we worry about what others think of us. At age 40, we don't care what they think of us. At age 60, we discover they haven't been thinking of us at all.”

title: Did Howie Mandel Compile This List of Justin Trudeau's Accomplishments?
subtitle: Celebrity names are often falsely attached to political opinions in an attempt to make them more shareable.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Comedian Howie Mandel penned a list of Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau's "accomplishments."

title: Did Lincoln Say, 'If You Want to Test a Man's Character, Give Him Power'?
subtitle: For nearly a century, people have made the mistake of claiming that a quotation about Lincoln was actually a quotation by him.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln once said, "If you want to test a man's character, give him power," or words to that effect.

title: Did Donald Trump Demand Immigrants 'Adapt' or Leave?
subtitle: A years-old rumor found a new target.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: Circulated text quotes President Donald Trump, among other things, demanding immigrants to "adapt" or leave the United States.

title: Did Comedian Tim Allen Write a Viral Facebook Attack on Democrats?
subtitle: Many social media users attributed to Tim Allen a set of "interesting points to think about prior to 2020." But which Tim Allen?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The comedian and actor Tim Allen wrote a lengthy Facebook post that attacked liberals and Democratic politicians and was shared widely in August 2019.

title: Did Charlie Chaplin Write the Poem, 'As I Began to Love Myself'?
subtitle: Sometimes the author of a poem gets lost in translation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Silent-era actor Charlie Chaplin wrote a poem entitled, "As I Began to Love Myself."

title: Did Werner Herzog Tweet America Is 'Waking Up, As Germany Once Did'?
subtitle: We know this much: The German film director isn't the biggest fan of social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Werner Herzog said: "Dear America: You are waking up as Germany once did, to the awareness that 1/3 of your people would kill another 1/3, while 1/3 watches."

title: Did Keanu Reeves Really Say This About Living Life Fully?
subtitle: This quote has been attributed to everyone EXCEPT the original author.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Keanu Reeves said: "None of us are getting out of here alive, so please stop treating yourself like an after thought."

title: Is a 'Beware of Artists' Poster from the McCarthy Era?
subtitle: While this poster may express the sentiments of the McCarthy era, this quote can actually be traced back to the 1800s.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A "Beware of Artists" poster was issued by Sen. Joseph McCarthy in the 1950s.

title: Did Comedian Steve Harvey Praise President Trump as a Politically Incorrect 'Fixer'?
subtitle: Facebook users attributed an unusual analogy about "raccoons" to "Steve Harvey" in early 2019. But which Steve Harvey?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The comedian and broadcaster Steve Harvey once praised Donald Trump as a flawed but effective president hired to "get rid of" the Democratic and Republican parties, as well as undocumented immigrants.

title: Did Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Say 'Under Capitalism, Man Oppresses Man. Under Socialism, It's Just the Opposite'?
subtitle: It seems a little unlikely that a 29-year-old would be the originator of an "old Soviet joke" several decades old.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Newly elected Democratic Party Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said, "'Under capitalism, man oppresses man. Under socialism, it's just the opposite.'"

title: Did Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Declare 'I Have a Very Good Brain'?
subtitle: A meme attributed an unusual statement to the wrong New York politician.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. Representative-Elect Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez once said, "I have a very good brain."

title: Winston Churchill on Caring What Other People Think of You
subtitle: Churchill opined about many things, but the impact of aging on how much one cares about what other people think wasn't one of them.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Winston Churchill once said: “When you're 20 you care what everybody thinks, when you're 40 you stop caring what everyone thinks, when you're 60 you realize no one was ever thinking about you in the first place.”

title: Winston Churchill on Muslims and Minority Rights
subtitle: The first rule of quotations is that people rarely say much after they have died.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Winston Churchill once said “when Muslims are in the minority they are very concerned with minority rights, when they are in the majority there are no minority rights.”

title: Did Judge Robert Meadows Pen an Essay Entitled 'Thank You, Canada?'
subtitle: A viral piece urges Americans to be thankful for their Canadian neighbors.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Florida Circuit Court Judge Robert Meadows penned an essay entitled "Thank You Canada," in which he urged readers to be more appreciative of our northern neighbors.

title: Did Chuck Grassley Warn About 'Giving Americans the False Impression That Women Have Equal Rights?'
subtitle: A statement about women's rights attributed to the Senate Judiciary Chair gave voice to what many people were thinking.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Sen. Chuck Grassley warned that investigating "every" allegation of sexual assault would create the "false impression that women have equal rights."

title: Did David Attenborough Say 'I Am Unaware of Any Animal That Is as Cruel as Israelis'?
subtitle: A stray comment on an Iranian news web site formed the basis of a bizarre meme involving Sir David Attenborough.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: David Attenborough said that "I am unaware of any animal that is as cruel as Israelis" as part of a scathing attack on the country's treatment of the Palestinian people.

title: Did Nike Say They Can Afford to “Let Go of All 'Make America Great Again' Customers”?
subtitle: Nike may not be "taking a drastic hit to their bottom line," but they didn't say that quite so bluntly themselves.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Nike said that they're a "$76 billion dollar company that can afford to let go of all 'Make America Great Again' customers."

title: Did Actor Morgan Freeman Call President Trump a 'Bonafide Sack of Sh*t?'
subtitle: An expletive-laden tweet excoriating the president in the wake of the Jacksonville shootings was mistaken by some as having been written by actor Morgan Freeman.
author: David Emery
statement: In a tweet tagged "@realDonaldTrump," actor Morgan Freeman wrote that "Our President is a bonafide sack of shit."

title: Did John F. Kennedy Ask 'Suppose God is Black?'
subtitle: A speculative question about God's being black originated with one of the Kennedys, but it wasn't President John F. Kennedy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: John F. Kennedy posed a speculative question about what would happen if God were black.

title: Cicero's 'Two Thousand Year Old Warning' About Treason
subtitle: For critics of President Trump, an old quotation about "treason from within" was relevant in 2018. But who actually came up with it?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The Roman orator Cicero issued a warning about a nation's being destroyed by "treason from within."

title: Did a Professor Named Jack Minzey Write About 'A Modern Civil War'?
subtitle: An opinion piece arguing that the United States is in the midst of a Civil War was incorrectly attributed to a veteran and emeritus professor at Eastern Michigan University.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A military veteran and educator wrote an opinion piece arguing that the United States is in a modern Civil War.

title: Did Charles Krauthammer Write an 'Interesting Take on Trump?'
subtitle: An opinion piece arguing that President Donald Trump is a pragmatist rather than a Republican or a Democrat was written by Mychal Massie, not Charles Krauthammer.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Charles Krathammer wrote an op-ed which argues that U.S. President Donald Trump is not a Republican or a Democrat, but a pragmatist.

title: Robert Reich's Rules for 2018?
subtitle: A list of rules on how to "resist" the Trump administration was incorrectly attributed to the author and political commentator.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Author Robert Reich published a list of ten rules to help "resist" the Trump administration in 2018.

title: 'He Fights': President Trump's Lack of Decorum
subtitle: The authorship of an opinion piece defending President Trump's lack of decorum and dignity in office has been misattributed.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Dr. Marshall Kamena, the Democratic mayor of Livermore, California, wrote an opinion piece defending President Trump's lack of decorum.

title: Did Pope Francis Write the 'Gentle Reminder' Message?
subtitle: The uplifting message offers tips on how to live more fulfilling lives, and encourages less complaining.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pope Francis wrote a viral Facebook post offering a "gentle reminder" about what's important in life.

title: Did Charles Krauthammer Write an Op-Ed Called 'The Enemy Among Us?'
subtitle: The
author: Dan Evon
statement: Columnist Charles Krauthammer wrote an opinion piece entitled "The Enemy Among Us" alleging that former President Barack Obama was creating a "shadow government" through his nonprofit Organizing for Action.

title: Did an NFL Owner Order His Players to Stand During the National Anthem?
subtitle: An NFL owner didn't tell his players they were "actors" playing the role of "patriotic super heroes" and therefore had to stand during the playing of the U.S. national anthem.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An NFL owner told his players they were "actors" playing the role of "patriotic super heroes" and therefore had to stand during the playing of the U.S. national anthem.

title: Did Robert Mueller Say He Supported a 'One-World Government'?
subtitle: The falsely-attributed quote may have been written by a former UN official with a similar name.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Robert Mueller called for a switch to a "One-World" system of leadership, religion, and government.

title: Andy Rooney's Political Views
subtitle: A supposed transcript of the late '60 Minutes' commentator Andy Rooney's explaining his political views is a fabrication.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A transcript reproduces '60 Minutes' commentator Andy Rooney's explaining his political views.

title: Maureen Dowd's 'Election Therapy' Column
subtitle: Now circulating: a celebration of Donald Trump's election triumph attributed to New York Times columnist Maureen Dowd, but actually written by her brother.
author: David Emery
statement: New York Times columnist hailed the election of Donald Trump as a "complete repudiation of Barack Obama."

title: John Cleese's Letter to the USA
subtitle: Former Monty Python member John Cleese did not pen a satirical piece announcing the revocation of America's independence for failure to elect a competent president.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former Monty Python member John Cleese penned a satirical piece announcing the revocation of America's independence for failure to elect a competent president.

title: Did Billy Graham Issue a Stunning Statement on Donald Trump?
subtitle: A viral rumor misattributed commentary about choosing between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump from Franklin Graham to his father, Billy Graham.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Reverend Billy Graham issued a surprising statement in support of Donald Trump.

title: Ben Carson: Muslims Worship 'the Moon God of Arabia'?
subtitle: An essay denigrating American Muslims has been a viral e-mail forward for at least a decade and did not originate with former Republican president candidate Dr. Ben Carson.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A viral e-mail claiming that Muslims can't be good Americans because they worship a "moon God" is a quote from former GOP presidential candidate Ben Carson.

title: 'If Voting Made a Difference, They Wouldn't Let Us Do It'
subtitle: A quote concerning the irrelevancy of voting is often attributed to American humorist Mark Twain.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mark Twain once said that "If voting made a difference, they wouldn't let us do it. "

title: Colin Powell 'Supreme Court Vacancy' Quote
subtitle: A quote warning people about how a Hillary Clinton presidency would result in a liberal Supreme Court did not originate with Colin Powell.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Colin Powell urged people to vote for Donald Trump so that they could put a conservative on the Supreme Court.

title: 'First They Ignore You, Then They Laugh at You' Quote Isn't Gandhi's
subtitle: A quote misattributed to Mahatma Gandhi started recirculating after it was tweeted by presidential candidate Donald Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The famous quote "First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win” originated with Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Donald Trump Editorial via The New Yorker?
subtitle: A widely-circulated editorial about Donald Trump didn't reach viral popularity until it was misattributed to the magazine 'The New Yorker.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The New Yorker published a surprisingly effusive item praising the political acumen of Donald Trump, penned by a Bloomberg reporter.

title: 'If it can be destroyed by the truth, it deserves to be destroyed by the truth'
subtitle: The statement "If it can be destroyed by the truth, it deserves to be destroyed by the truth," is widely misattributed to Carl Sagan.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Carl Sagan said "if it can be destroyed by the truth, it deserves to be destroyed by the truth."

title: Peggy Noonan on Donald Trump
subtitle: A popular e-mail forward about Donald Trump wasn't written by Peggy Noonan, nor was it published in the Wall Street Journal.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Peggy Noonan penned a 'Wall Street Journal' piece lauding Donald Trump.

title: Clinton Foundation Money Laundering
subtitle: An e-mail forward incorrectly attributed to Charles Krauthammer asserted that the Clinton Foundation was "'organized crime' at its finest."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Clinton Foundation is a tax-free "international money laundering scheme."

title: An Interesting Take on Trump
subtitle: Conservative commentator William J. Bennett did not pen an essay hypothesizing that Donald Trump would be killed before he could be elected President.
author: Dan Evon

title: Quoth Keanu?
subtitle: A viral quote describing various tragedies in the life of Keanu Reeves was not penned by the actor.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Keanu Reeves posted a message on his personal Facebook page about the difficulties he has overcome in life.

title: Did Baltimore Sun Publish 'The Black Dilemma'?
subtitle: The controversial essay has actually been circulating on the internet since at least September 2014.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An editorial entitled "The Black Dilemma" was published in the Baltimore Sun newspaper.

title: The American Dream Ended Last Night in Ohio?
subtitle: A speech by Franklin Graham laments that the American dream ended with the re-election of Barack Obama in 2012?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Speech by Franklin Graham laments that the American dream ended with the re-election of Barack Obama.

title: Did Sarah Palin Say: 'I Can See Russia from My House'?
subtitle: 2008 GOP vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin did not say 'I can see Russia from my house.'  That line originated with an SNL spoof.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: During the 2008 presidential campaign, VP candidate Sarah Palin said: "I can see Russia from my house."

title: Abraham Lincoln on Prosperity
subtitle: Abraham Lincoln did not author a list of maxims beginning with 'You cannot bring about prosperity by discouraging thrift.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Abraham Lincoln authored a list of maxims beginning with 'You cannot bring about prosperity by discouraging thrift.'"

title: Is This a High School Principal's Speech to the Incoming Class?
subtitle: A speculative "What I would say if I were in that position" column has been confusingly cast as a real speech.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A transcript reproduces a high school principal's speech to students and faculty at the beginning of a new school year.

title: Bill Cosby and “I'm 83 and Tired”
subtitle: Did an opinion piece by Bill Cosby detail political and social issues he's tired of?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Opinion piece by Bill Cosby details political and social issues he's tired of.

title: Obituary: Common Sense
subtitle: Essay by George Carlin laments the passing of common sense?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Essay by George Carlin laments the passing of common sense.

title: Did Andy Rooney Write 'In Praise of Older Women'?
subtitle: Did '60 Minutes' commentator Andy Rooney author an essay titled 'In Praise of Older Women'?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: 60 Minutes commentator Andy Rooney wrote an essay, "In Praise of Older Women."

title: Some Rules Kids Won't Learn in School
subtitle: Bill Gates has been busy doing other things than compiling lists of rules for youngsters to observe.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates authored a list of 'Rules Kids Won't Learn in School.'

title: Billy Graham's 'Prayer for Our Nation'
subtitle: A 'Prayer for Our Nation' variously attributed to the Rev. Billy Graham and Paul Harvey was penned by neither man.
author: David Mikkelson

title: George Soros – One Evil Human
subtitle: Steve Kroft of '60 Minutes' penned an article critical of George Soros?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Steve Kroft of CBS' 60 Minutes penned an article critical of George Soros.

title: Andy Rooney on Everything
subtitle: A collection of late commentator Andy Rooney's supposedly wry observations on a variety of topics.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A list compiles Andy Rooney's wry observations on a variety of topics.

title: Hurricane Rules
subtitle: A diatribe "list of hurricane rules" prompted by Hurricane Katrina in 2005 was wrongly attributed to comedian George Carlin.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Comedian George Carlin authored a list of "hurricane rules."

title: In Defense of Prayer
subtitle: "I don't think a short prayer at a football game is going to shake the world's foundations."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Paul Harvey or news commentator Andy Rooney wrote an essay in favor of prayer.

title: 'Immigrants, Not Americans, Must Adapt'
subtitle: A purported speech by a national leader encouraging Muslim immigrants to adapt or go back where they came from is misattributed.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former Australian prime minister Julia Gillard made a speech encouraging Muslims to leave Australia.
